summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 18621, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of North Eighty-fourth Street, from Greenwood Avenue to Stone Avenue, and Woodland Park Avenue, from North Eighty-second Street to North Eighty-fourth Street, all in the City of Seattle, by laying water mains of proper dimensions and material, together with all necessary gates, tees and crosses necessary for the reasonable water service of said district, in accordance with Resolution No. 1231 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle," approved on the fifteenth day of June, 1908.
